name: Device-Independent Bitmap Image
summary: Learn about .DIB files and view a list of programs that open them.

content:
A DIB contains the following color and dimension information:

The color format of the device on which the rectangular image was created.The resolution of the device on which the rectangular image was created.The palette for the device on which the image was created.An array of bits that maps red, green, blue ( RGB ) triplets to pixels in the rectangular image.A data-compression identifier that indicates the data compression scheme (if any) used to reduce the size of the array of bits.

Microsoft developed the DIB format for use with the Windows and OS/2 (Operating System/2) operating systems. The format supports 1-, 4-, 8-, or 24-bit pixels for uncompressed images, and 4- or 8-bit pixels for RLE-compressed images. 24-bit DIB images use 8 bits for each RGB color.

instructions: You can open a DIB file with most image viewers and editors, including Microsoft Photos (Windows), Apple Preview (Mac), XnViewMP (multiplatform), and Adobe Photoshop (Windows, Mac).
